svg.text: AI Runtime Behaviour Security — Decision Poster
Find your deployment. Get your controls. Know your fail posture. One page.
✓ Internal users only ✓ Read-only (no write to external systems)
✓ No regulated data ✓ Human reviews before acting on output
→ Self-certify. Deploy in days. No security review needed.
Internal tools with write access, OR handles non-regulated data,
OR output not always reviewed. Internal audience only.
Customer-facing content or decisions. Human reviews before
delivery. Decision support, document processing, chatbots.
Regulated decisions, autonomous agents with write access,
financial / medical / legal domains. Direct business impact.
Same model can be different tiers based on use case.
If agent has write access or autonomous actions, also require:
Tool permission matrix · Transaction resolution plan · Multi-agent
For each control, decide: when it fails, does the system...
Fail-closed always. No exceptions. Immediate escalation.
Manual process (already exists). Feature flag off.
Manual process. Documented. Someone knows how.
Staffed parallel process. Tested monthly. No shared infra.
PACE — WHAT HAPPENS WHEN CONTROLS DEGRADE
Throttle AI to match capacity (or stop)
□ Degradation phases defined with trigger criteria
□ Transaction resolution for every tool (rollback? complete without agent? partial dangerous?)
□ Multi-agent cascade prevention (timeouts, fallback behaviour, no blocking)
□ Non-AI fallback path tested and staffed
THE FIVE QUESTIONS EVERY AI DEPLOYMENT MUST ANSWER BEFORE PRODUCTION
If you can answer all five, you're ready. If you can't, you're not.
ISO 42001 · NIST AI RMF · OWASP LLM Top 10 · OWASP Agentic Top 10 · NIST SP 800-218A · EU AI Act
Scope: Custom AI in production. Not: vendor products, model training, pre-deployment testing.
This framework starts where NIST SP 800-218A (secure development) ends.
Fast Lane: FAST-LANE.md · PACE Methodology: PACE-RESILIENCE.md · Infrastructure: 80 controls / 11 domains
MIT License — Use it, adapt it, build on it.
AI Runtime Behaviour Security — Decision Poster v1.0 © Jonathan Gill 2025
Guardrails prevent. Judge detects. Humans decide. Circuit breakers contain.
